criteria.name: Scenario Quality (SC)
criteria.description: Evaluates whether the scenario is realistic, contextually rich, and useful for helping students transfer project knowledge to a relevant design decision.

criteria.name: Alignment (AL)
criteria.description: Measures how closely the design problem reflects the intended learning objectives, without introducing unrelated skills or omitting core outcomes.

criteria.name: Cognitive Complexity (CC)
criteria.description: Assesses whether the design problem engages students in higher-order thinking (analyzing, evaluating, and designing) rather than only recalling facts.

criteria.name: Clarity & Specificity (CS)
criteria.description: Checks if the design problem is clearly stated, self-contained, and free of ambiguities that could confuse or mislead students.

criteria.name: Feasibility (FS)
criteria.description: Determines whether the design problem is appropriately scoped and solvable within 30 minutes by students with expected prior knowledge.
